title: Simon Cowell announces X Factor rules shake-up but viewers are distracted by his glasses

X Factor: Celebrity returned tonight as famous faces battled it out in the singing competition's first live shows of the series.

Judge Simon Cowell surprised viewers when he announced at the start that the show had added a new twist to the elimination process.

The live shows usually introduce the six chair challenge, where the acts that are put through are sat on one of six chairs, but they can get dethroned the judges decide to put another act through instead.

This time around, there will only be three chairs, and once acts are sat in them their place in next week's show is confirmed.

Simon explained: "The bad news is the chairs are back. the good news is there’s only three. if you get a chair you stay in the chair you’re not up for eviction."

(Image: ITV)

(Image: ITV)

Nicole added: "They’re happy chairs!".

Meanwhile the Twitter account for the X Factor tweeted: "HUGE NEWS! Each Judge has a #SafeSeat each to give to one of their acts. This means three acts will be safe from elimination tonight."

But viewers were distracted by Simon Cowell's unusual eyewear.

(Image: Reuters)

He sported a pair of thin glasses along with his normal uniform of a dangerously low buttoned shirt.

Fans of the show were quick to compare Simon to a famous bespectacled wizard.

"My child just said Simon looks like an old Harry Potter in his specs", tweeted one viewer.

"Simon Cowell dressing up early for Halloween as Harry Potter", joked another.

His look went down well with some, with one tweeting: "Simon Cowell looks fabulous wearing spectacles".

Others weren't keen, with one questioning: "What the f**k does Simon look like?"
description: Simon Cowell sported some trendy new specs on tonight's show, but viewers compared him to another famous glasses wearer
